lines.text:
[Cutting into Ann Marie's birthday cake]
You know what? Not so long ago your daddy and I went to a birthday party in China.
Uh-huh. At a Mandarin's house. His name was
Did you have ice cream and cake?
Oooh, no indeed. We had swallows' nests, umm, roasted silkworms, snake soup and, uh - cricket eggs!
Oh, we had to take a double helping of everything or the Mandarin would've murdered us.
Oh well, Uncle Charles - nobody will murder you here!
I have been an intermezzo in his life.
I wonder if anyone has built happiness on the unhappiness of others.
